channel.title: Code too large?
channel.description: [IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/35k4wsz.jpg[/img] is there a possible way i can make it handle more? because ive done this just triyng to fix the nulls in my client ive been building.. its a good client... compatable with alot of server. but im trying to fix nulls so i can make it into a webclient... how can i make it handle more.. or add items without class8.java?? and PLEASE dont give me that stupid answer of.. "take stuff out"... cause that just being lazy

item.title: Code too large?
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

Don’t hardcode the items. You could load them through the cache like Zee Best or Miss Silabsoft.

Or another way to make it handle more items is by making it a switch statement. So, for instance where it says

if(itemId == 12345) { //stuff here }

You would make that

case 12345: //stuff here break;

Under

class8.method203(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_183);

You would need to put

switch(i) {

and then at the end of your items, put a

 }

Read full topic
